DataElement.preferredName: Person Biological Entity Or Sex Gender Code OMOP CDM Gender Concept Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A single human being.:Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving)._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.:The assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique gender of the person.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Biological Entity Or Sex Gender Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A single human being.:Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving)._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.:The assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A single human being.:Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.
An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).

Property.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.:The assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.

Characteristics of people that are socially constructed, including norms, behaviors, and roles based on sex. As a social construct, gender varies from society to society and can change over time. (Adapted from WHO.)
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval.  mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique gender of the person.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Not provided or available.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare congenital abnormality in which the infant's external genitalia do not have the typical appearance of a male's or female's genitalia.

Concepts.definition: A rare congenital abnormality in which the infant's external genitalia do not have the typical appearance of a male's or female's genitalia.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
